intro: Pimpinella diversifolia var. diversifolia, commonly known as the variable cow parsley, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. It has a taproot system and is often found in temperate regions of Asia. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the carrot family with ornamental and ecological value.
